meanings.sent1: The magnet had a measurement of milligausses on the scale.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the magnetic field in milligausses.
meanings.sent3: The tiny magnet only registered a few milligausses, much to the amusement of the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The milligausses of magnetic force in the room made the compasses spin wildly.
meanings.sent5: The milligausses were so low that the compass barely moved, showing the weak magnetic field.

meanings.definition: A unit of magnetic flux density equal to one thousandth of a gauss.
meanings.sent1: The device measured the magnetic field in milligausses accurately.
meanings.sent2: The milligausses reading indicated a weak magnetic field in the area.
meanings.sent3: The machine beeped loudly when it reached the milligausses level, causing a moment of amusement in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The milligausses of magnetic energy in the room felt almost palpable, like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The milligausses were so low that even the most sensitive equipment struggled to detect them.
